title: GTA Online Horse Track Guesser – rename, fractional odds UI, and Android APK help

requirements.summary: Rename all user-visible app name occurrences to "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" (header title, icon alt text, and document title).
acceptanceCriteria: The header (AppHeader) shows "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" as the app title.
The app icon image alt text uses "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser".
The browser tab/document title is "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" (frontend/index.html title updated).

file_operations.description: Update the header title text and app icon alt text from "Race Predictor" to the exact new name "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser".
Update the HTML document <title> text to "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" so the browser tab title matches the new app name.

requirements.summary: Change the New Entry odds input to fractional numerator-only input with a fixed, non-editable "/1" suffix and a blank "-/1" visual state, while keeping stored odds numeric and validation intact.
acceptanceCriteria: In the New Entry flow, each contender (1–6) shows a single numeric field for the numerator and a non-editable "/1" suffix.
When the numerator is empty, the UI reads as "-/1" (e.g., placeholder '-' in the numerator field with the visible '/1' suffix).
The app continues to store and use odds as numeric values for prediction/learning (numerator interpreted as X in X/1).
Validation errors remain in English and still prevent prediction/save when odds are missing or <= 0.

file_operations.description: Update the contenders odds input row UI to: (1) accept a single numeric numerator only (use integer-friendly settings such as step=1), (2) render a constant, non-editable "/1" suffix immediately next to the input, (3) show a blank "-/1" state by using '-' as the input placeholder while keeping the visible '/1' suffix, and (4) continue storing odds as a numeric value used by prediction/learning (numerator interpreted as X in X/1). Ensure existing validation behavior is preserved (missing/<=0 blocks predict/save with English errors).

Review and adjust contender-odds validation messaging/logic as needed to ensure it still correctly treats empty numerator as missing (odds 0) and blocks predict/save when odds are missing or <= 0, with English-language error strings.

requirements.summary: Render all displayed odds in the UI as fractional "{numerator}/1" instead of raw numbers and update any fractional examples/placeholders accordingly.
acceptanceCriteria: In History, each contender badge renders odds like "#3 (29/1)" rather than "#3 (29)".
No part of the UI displays contender odds as a plain decimal/float placeholder example (e.g., remove or update "Enter odds (e.g., 2.5)" to a fractional example).

file_operations.description: Add a small shared formatter utility for odds display (e.g., convert a numeric odds value into a fractional string like "{numerator}/1"), to keep formatting consistent across Entry and History UIs.
Update contender badge rendering to display odds in fractional format "{numerator}/1" (e.g., "#3 (29/1)") using the shared odds formatting utility instead of showing the raw numeric odds value.

Update any user-facing odds helper text and placeholders to match fractional numerator-only input (remove/update decimal example text like "Enter odds (e.g., 2.5)" and align with the "-/1" blank state and fixed "/1" suffix).

requirements.summary: Add an in-app, English-language "Android APK" help section explaining how to generate a usable Android APK by wrapping the deployed web app URL in a WebView using a website-to-APK generator (including websitetoapk.com).
acceptanceCriteria: The app UI contains a clearly discoverable "Android APK" (or similar) help area that provides step-by-step instructions.
The instructions mention that this is a web app and describe the approach of using a WebView wrapper, including the example generator URL "websitetoapk.com".
All help text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create an in-app help UI section titled "Android APK" (or similar) containing English step-by-step instructions explaining that the app is a web app and that a usable Android APK can be created by wrapping the deployed site URL in a WebView via a website-to-APK generator; explicitly mention the example generator "websitetoapk.com".

Wire the new Android APK help section into the existing UI in a clearly discoverable way (e.g., add a new TabsTrigger/TabsContent alongside "New Entry" and "History" that renders the AndroidApkHelp component). Ensure it is reachable from the main navigation and not an orphaned component.
